questions.uddipok:
Read the passage about Abraham Lincoln and complete the following table with information from the passage: Abraham Lincoln was the 16th President of the USA. He is renowned for his Gettysburg Address, delivered during the American Civil War on November 19, 1863. Lincoln was born on February 12, 1809 in Kentucky, USA. His parents hailed from Virginia. In 1819, his mother passed away, prompting his father to move the family to Indiana, where Lincoln grew up. He served as a captain in the Black Hawk War. In 1860, he was nominated for the presidency and was elected as the President of the USA in 1861. Lincoln famously issued the Emancipation Proclamation, declaring a ban on slavery in America on January 1, 1863. He was re-elected in 1864. Tragically, on Good Friday, April 14, 1865, he was assassinated at Ford's theatre in Washington D.C.
Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Abraham Lincoln was born on February 12, 1809, in Kentucky. His parents were from Virginia, and after his mother passed away in 1819, his family moved to Indiana. Lincoln served as a captain in the Black Hawk War and later became the 16th President of the United States, elected in 1861. During his presidency, he delivered the Gettysburg Address and issued the Emancipation Proclamation, which banned slavery in 1863. He was re-elected in 1864 but was tragically assassinated at Ford's Theatre in Washington D.C. on April 14, 1865.

questions.uddipok:
Write a paragraph on 'A Street Hawkar' answering the following questions:
(a) Who is a street hawker? (b) Where does he usually live? (c) How does he earn his livelihood? (d) How does he attract his customers? (e) How is his lifestyle?

sub_questions.explanation:
A Street Hawkar

A street hawker is a common sight in bustling towns and cities. He is a hardworking individual who earns his livelihood by selling goods on the streets. With a basket balanced on his head, a cart, or a portable stall, he roams from one neighborhood to another, calling out his wares in a loud, melodic voice to attract customers. Street hawkers often sell a variety of items, including fruits, vegetables, toys, snacks, or household goods. Their offerings vary with the time of day and the season, catering to the changing needs of the public.
The life of a street hawker is not easy. They face long hours under the scorching sun, unpredictable weather, and the constant challenge of competing with others for customers. Despite this, they often exude cheerfulness, as their survival depends on building relationships with their patrons. Hawkers bring convenience to people’s doorsteps, especially for those who cannot visit markets.
However, their presence can sometimes cause congestion and noise in busy areas. Nonetheless, they play an essential role in the local economy, offering affordable goods to people from all walks of life. A street hawker embodies resilience, adaptability, and the entrepreneurial spirit that thrives in urban life.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Add at least ten new sentences to complete the story. Give a suitable title to it.
One day a crow became very thirsty. He flew from place to place in search of water. But he found no water. He continued his search for water ……………

sub_questions.explanation:
A Thirsty Crow
One day, a crow became very thirsty. He flew from place to place in search of water. But he found no water. He continued his search for water. At last, he saw a jar. He peeped into the jar and saw that there was a little water at the bottom of the jar. He tried to drink water but his bill could not reach it. He tried again and again but in vain. He became very sad and hopeless. Suddenly, he saw some small pieces of stone near the jar. A good idea came into his head. He picked up the stones and dropped them into the jar one by one. As a result, the water came up to the brim. The crow then drank water from it to his heart's content and flew away with a joyful mind.

questions.uddipok:
Suppose, you are Habib/Habiba. The annual prize-giving ceremony of your school was held yesterday.
Now, write an email to your friend, Fahim/Fahima deseribing about it.

sub_questions.explanation:
To : nasim@gmail.com
Subject : The annual prize giving ceremony

Hi Nasim,

Yesterday was our school prize-giving day. On this occasion, our school auditorium was brightly decorated. Prizes were also neatly displayed on a separate table on the dais. All the students were present at the function. Among others, the guardians and some eminent persons of the locality also attended the function. The principal of PN College was the chief guest. The function started on time - just at 4 p.m. Our Headteacher first read out the annual report. Then the Chief Guest gave a short speech. He highly praised the overall performance of the school and its excellent SSC Exam results. Then he gave away the prizes among the students for their outstanding activities. You will be glad to know that I've got two prizes - one for regular attendance and the other for good results in the last year-ending exams.

Thanking you, Amin

questions.uddipok:
Suppose you are Nabil/Nabila. You have a friend called Nabeen/Nabeena. Both of you are very interested in different types of games and sports.
Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend emphasizing the importance of games and sports in our life.

sub_questions.explanation:
Nabeen/Nabeena ：Hi Nabil/Nabila, where are you heading to?
Nabil/Nabila : Hi, I'm on my way to the sports club.
Nabeen/Nabeena : What do you do there?
Nabil/Nabila : Well, I practise badminton there.
Nabeen/Nabeena : That's interesting!Do you go there often?
Nabil/Nabila : Yes, almost every day. It keeps my body and mind fit. Do you participate in any sports, Nabeen/Nabeena?
Nabeen/Nabeena : Yes, I do.
Nabil/Nabila : Which sports are you interested in?
Nabeen/Nabeena : I usually play cricket and football to keep my body fit and healthy.
Nabil/Nabila : I think, games are essential for good health.
Nabeen/Nabeena : You're right, Nabil/Nabila. Games are essential for a healthy body.
Nabil/Nabila : Some people don't like physical activities. They don't realize the importance of games.
Nabeen/Nabeena : But such people always suffer from one or the other ailment.
Nabil/Nabila : You're absolutely right.
Nabeen/Nabeena : I personally think that games should be made compulsory for the students.
Nabil/Nabila : I agree with you. Games will keep the students healthy and teach them discipline.
Nabeen/Nabeena : Discipline is very essential for the progress of an individual as well as the nation as a whole.
Nabil/Nabila : Games also teach us the spirit of sportsmanship while developing the quality of leadership among the students.
Nabeen/Nabeena : 'Health is wealth', is an old saying. Therefore, to maintain our health we must play games.
Nabil/Nabila : Yes. You're right. Well, I've to go now. We should meet up again, may be next week.
Nabeen/Nabeena : Sure! See you then.
Nabil/Nabila : Bye, bye.
Nabeen/Nabeena : good bye.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions.

a. Where does Meherjan live?

b. Who are the worst sufferers of climate change?

c. What crushed Meherjan's dream and happiness? How?

d. What property did Meherjan lose due of river erosion?

e. What will hapepen if we cannot control river erosion?

f. Do you agree with the view that we should take prompt actions to adapt to climate change? Why?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Meherjan lives in a polythene-roofed shelter in a. slum on the Sirajgonj, Town Protection Embankment.

(b) The people who live along the river banks are the worst sufferers of climate change. It is because climate change has increased river erosion.

(c) The greedy Jamuna crushed Meherjan's dream and happiness by eating up her landed property, house, trees, vegetable garden and the bamboo bush.

(d) Meherjan lost her home, cultivable land, trees, vegetable garden, and the bamboo bush due to river erosion.

(e) If we cannot control river erosion, many more people like Meherjan will become homeless every year in Bangladesh. River erosion is a major threat caused by climate change and affects the lives of thousands of people every year.

(f) Yes, I agree with the view. It is because climate change is the main reason of river erosion. So, we have to stop polluting the environment first. Then, we have to dredge our rivers and make embankment to adapt to the change.
